results.title: Harvey
results.creator_credit: Peter McDonald, Rachel Roberts, Priscilla Collins and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A dark tale of obsession and loneliness about a grotesque man searching literally and metaphorically for his other half. Through the violent coalescence of his neighbour he achieves his goal, but her resistance forces him to face the painful, irresolvable nature of his obsession with completeness. Cast includes Nicholas Hope and Lisa Angove. Written by Peter McDonald, photography by Murray Lui.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter McDonald, Rachel Roberts, Priscilla Collins and AFTRS

results.title: Harvey
results.creator_credit: Rachel Roberts, Priscilla Collins, Peter McDonald and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Peter McDonald’s Harvey takes the notion of ‘finding your other half’ to its logical and very gory conclusion. In stark black and white, a woman is spied on by an unseen man who lives in the apartment across from her. When the woman falls in the shower and is knocked unconscious, the man takes this opportunity to finally reveal his true, mangled self. Cast features Nicholas Hope as Harvey and Lisa Angove as Lily.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rachel Roberts, Priscilla Collins, Peter McDonald and AFTRS

results.title: Harvey
results.creator_credit: Rachel Roberts, Priscilla Collins, AFTRS and Peter McDonald
results.brief_description: A dark tale of obsession and loneliness about a man searching for physical and emotional completeness. It is only when he thinks he has achieved this goal through the unwilling coalescence of his neighbour that he begins to understand the painful, irresolvable nature of his obsession. Stars Nicholas Hope as Harvey and Lisa Angove as Lily.

results.title: Harvey
results.creator_credit: John Beck, Universal International Pictures and Henry Koster
results.brief_description: Based on the Pulitzer prize play written by Mary Chase, James Stewart gives one of his finest performances as Elwood P. Dowd. A good-natured soul, his constant companion is a six-foot-eight rabbit called Harvey, who is only visible to Elwood. To his sister, Veta Louise, Elwood’s obsession with Harvey has been a thorn in the side of her plans to marry off her daughter. When she finally decides to commit Elwood to a mental institution, an hilarious mix-up results in her own committal. Elwood and his imaginary friend finally make things right. At the start of this video, Jimmy Stewart talks about the film and his long association with “Harvey”.

results.title: Harvests for tomorrow
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of Agriculture and Edgar Peterson II
results.brief_description: New England farmers, like farmers in all the north-eastern states of the US, have found that the need for soil conservation and soil-building practices is an urgent necessity if their land is to continue to yield good returns in years to come. This film presents the program for improvement of pastures, introducing with considerable insight the farmers themselves, and the dry humour with which they face their most serious problems. Narrated by Frank Craven.

results.title: Harvesting the snows
results.brief_description: Surveys the Snowy Mountains Scheme - largest engineering project ever undertaken in Australia at the time. Outlines the plan for diverting the waters of the Snowy to the Murray. Shows the Guthega Dam and power station; construction in the Guthega Munyang tunnel; the plan for the [new] Adaminaby Dam and early stages of its construction.

results.title: Harvesting
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Guy L. Cote, Marcel Martin and Arthur Lamothe
results.brief_description: A visual poem about the wheat harvest on the vast Canadian prairies. Here, reality is horizon-wide fields of grain that must be cut and threshed by the combines before frost lays the crop to waste. The images suggest a strange but magnificent military maneuver as a phalanx of giant machines lumbers across the golden acres.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Guy L. Cote, Marcel Martin and Arthur Lamothe

results.title: Harvest time
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine newsreel items including: 1. Ten Thousand Eggs a Day: A big pie-shaped henhouse in Nova Scotia produces eggs with assembly-line regularity. 2. Harvest on the Vine: A look at the Niagara wine industry shows how grapes are pressed and processed into Canadian wine. 3. Follow That Sheep: At Kamloops, British Columbia, a trek to the mountains with seven thousand sheep and two canny sheep dogs.

results.title: Harvest of the gulfs
results.creator_credit: Peter Dimond, Motion Picture Associates, South Australian Film Corporation and John Leake
results.brief_description: This film traces the research being undertaken by the South Australian Department of Fisheries into the life cycle, habitat and movements of the Western King Prawn in the South Australian gulf waters.

results.title: Harvest for tomorrow - Venezuela
results.creator_credit: Shell Film Unit and Lionel Cole
results.brief_description: Venezuela is investing the wealth obtained from petroleum production to further the development of her country. A large percentage of her foreign earnings come from oil, and the Government has embarked on a policy of using profits derived from oil to finance schemes of soil and water conservation, technical education, housing, road construction, scientific research and the mechanization of agriculture to further improve the standard of living for her people. Music by Edmundo Ros.
